00022 /*
00023 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00024 
00025 The PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method produces
00026 an improved signal by accounting for experimentally observed patterns 
00027 in probe behavior and handling error at the appropriately at low and 
00028 high signal values.
00029 
00030 >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>
00031 */
00032 
00033 /*
00034  * iaffyplier.h: iaffyplier interface class.
00035  *
00036  * NOTE: Users should use "caffyplier" as defined in "affyplier.h"
00037  *       This is an internal class.
00038  *
00039  */
00040 
00041 #if !defined(PLIER_INTERFACE_HEADER)
00042 #define PLIER_INTERFACE_HEADER
00043 
00044 #ifdef _NO_PLIER_DLL_
00045 #define plierdll
00046 #else
00047 #ifdef _MSVC
00048 #define plierdll __declspec( dllexport )
00049 #else
00050 #ifdef _GCC
00051 #define plierdll
00052 #else
00053 #ifdef __GNUC__
00054 #define plierdll
00055 #else
00056 #define plierdll __declspec( dllimport )
00057 #endif /* __GNUC__ */
00058 #endif /* _GCC */
00059 #endif /* _MSVC */
00060 #endif /* _NO_PLIER_DLL_ */
00061 
00062 #include "plier/affy_ptr.h"
00063 //
00064 
00065 #define FULL_MLE 0
00066 #define SEA 1
00067 #define MAX_IMPLNAME_LENGTH 255
00068 #define MAX_IMPLVER_LENGTH 32
00069 #define MAX_ERROR_LENGTH 1024
00070 #define IDENTIFY_SIZE 2
00071 #define IDENTIFY_MEDIAN 1
00072 #define IDENTIFY_SUM 0
00073 
00074 /*
00075  * PLIER Interfaces
00076  * An abstract C++ class
00077  */
00078 
00079 class iaffyplier
00080 {
00081 protected:
00082         iaffyplier() { refcnt = 0; }
00083         virtual ~iaffyplier() {}
00084 
00085 public:
00086 
00087         /*
00088          * Increment reference count
00089          */
00090         void addref() { ++refcnt; }
00091 
00092         /*
00093          * Decrement reference count, if zero, delete the current object
00094          */
00095         void release() 
00096         { 
00097                 if (refcnt > 0 && --refcnt == 0)
00098                         delete this;
00099         }
00100 
00101         /* PLIER parameters - Initialization */
00102         virtual void setInitAugmentation(double) = 0;          /* avoid zero values in input data */
00103         virtual void getInitAugmentation(double*) = 0;         /* return byref the value of augmentation */
00104         virtual void setInitDefaultFeatureResponse(double) = 0;       /* default FeatureResponses if not supplied */
00105         virtual void getInitDefaultFeatureResponse(double*) = 0;      /* return byref the value of default FeatureResponse */
00106         virtual void setInitDefaultTargetResponse(double) = 0;  /* default TargetResponse if not supplied */
00107         virtual void getInitDefaultTargetResponse(double*) = 0; /* return byref the value of default TargetResponse*/
00108 
00109         /* PLIER parameters - SEA */
00110         virtual void setSeaAttenuation(float) = 0;             /* set up attenuation of background */
00111         virtual void getSeaAttenuation(float*) = 0;            /* return byref the value of SEA attenuation */
00112 
00113         /* PLIER parameters - SEA Optimization */
00114         virtual void setSeaOptConvergence(double) = 0;        /* change in log-value at which to stop */
00115         virtual void getSeaOptConvergence(double*) = 0;       /* return byref the value of SEA convergence */
00116         virtual void setSeaOptIteration(long) = 0;            /* max number of SEA iteration to avoid infinite loops in SEA */
00117         virtual void getSeaOptIteration(long*) = 0;           /* return byref the value of SEA iteration */
00118 
00119         /* PLIER parameters - PLIER */
00120         virtual void setPlierGmCutoff(float) = 0;              /* set up robustness */
00121         virtual void getPlierGmCutoff(float*) = 0;             /* return byref the value of GMCutoff */
00122         virtual void setPlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty(float) = 0;          /* Bayes penalty for peculiar features */
00123         virtual void getPlierDifferentialFeaturePenalty(float*) = 0;         /* return byref the value of feature penalty */
00124         virtual void setPlierDifferentialTargetPenalty(float) = 0;           /* Bayes penalty for really peculiar TargetResponses */
00125         virtual void getPlierDifferentialTargetPenalty(float*) = 0;          /* return byref the value of TargetResponse penalty */
00126         virtual void setPlierUseMMLikelihood(bool) = 0;                 /* use mm or background based likelihood */
00127         virtual void getPlierUseMMLikelihood(bool*) = 0;                /* return byref the value of usemm */
00128         virtual void setPlierUseInputModel(bool) = 0;              /* Use provided values as the initial model of Feature Responses */
00129         virtual void getPlierUseInputModel(bool*) = 0;             /* return byref the value of usemodel */
00130         virtual void setPlierFitFeatureResponse(bool) = 0;           /* Fit Feature Response dynamically or don't update from initial values */
00131         virtual void getPlierFitFeatureResponse(bool*) = 0;          /* return byref the value of fitFeatureResponse */
00132 
00133         /* PLIER parameters - PLIER Optimization */
00134         virtual void setPlierOptConvergence(double) = 0;      /* change in likelihood */
00135         virtual void getPlierOptConvergence(double*) = 0;     /* return byref the value of PLIER convergence */
00136         virtual void setPlierOptIteration(long) = 0;          /* max number of PLIER iteration to avoid infinite loops in PLIER */
00137         virtual void getPlierOptIteration(long*) = 0;         /* return byref the value of PLIER iteration */
00138         virtual void setPlierOptDropMax(double) = 0;          /* "logarithmic" barrier near zero */
00139         virtual void getPlierOptDropMax(double*) = 0;         /* return byref the value of dropmax */
00140         virtual void setPlierOptLambdaLimit(double) = 0;      /* minimum step multiplier in method */
00141         virtual void getPlierOptLambdaLimit(double*) = 0;     /* return byref the value of lambdalimit */
00142         virtual void setPlierOptOptimizationMethod(long) = 0;       /* optimization method. either FULL_OPTIMIZATION or SEA */
00143         virtual void getPlierOptOptimizationMethod(long*) = 0;      /* return byref the value of optimization */
00144         virtual void setPlierOptBalanceMethod(long) = 0;       /* identifiability method: MEDIAN or SUM */
00145         virtual void getPlierOptBalanceMethod(long*) = 0;      /* return byref the value of identifiability method */
00146 
00147         /* PLIER Inputs */
00148         virtual void setNumExp(long) = 0;                      /* number of input experiments */
00149         virtual void getNumExp(long*) = 0;                     /* return byref the number of input experiments */
00150         virtual void setNumFeature(long) = 0;                    /* number of input features in each experiment */
00151         virtual void getNumFeature(long*) = 0;                   /* return byref the number of input features in each experiment */
00152         virtual void setReplicate(long*) = 0;                   /* replicate groups */
00153         virtual void getReplicate(long**) = 0;                  /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_replicate" method */
00154         virtual void setPM(double**) = 0;                       /* matrix of num_exp by num_probe stored by experiments (i.e. by row) */
00155         virtual void getPM(double***) = 0;                      /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_pm" method */
00156         virtual void setMM(double**) = 0;                       /* matrix of mismatch or background values, corresponds to structure of pm */
00157         virtual void getMM(double***) = 0;                      /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_mm" method */
00158         
00159         /*PLIER OPTIONAL INPUT*/
00160         virtual void setWT(double ** val) =0;                                   /*matrix of weights for input intensities*/
00161         virtual void getWT(double *** val)=0 ;                                  /*return by ref the pointer that set the matrix of weights*/
00162 
00163         /* PLIER Inputs/Outputs */
00164         virtual void setTargetResponse(double*) = 0;             /* array of length num_exp for estimated target responses */
00165         virtual void getTargetResponse(double**) = 0;            /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_targetresponse" method */
00166         virtual void setFeatureResponse(double*) = 0;                  /* array of length num_probe for estimated feature responses*/
00167         virtual void getFeatureResponse(double**) = 0;                 /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_featureresponse" method */
00168 
00169         /* PLIER Parameters (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00170         virtual void setUseTargetResponse(bool) = 0;            /* 1 if initial estimates of TargetResponse are provided */
00171         virtual void getUseTargetResponse(bool*) = 0;           /* return byref the value of the use_TargetResponse flag */
00172         virtual void setUseBg(bool) = 0;                       /* 0 if the bg data is not initialized */
00173         virtual void getUseBg(bool*) = 0;                      /* return byref the value of usebg */
00174         virtual void setUseTargetResponseSd(bool) = 0;                  /* 1 if initial estimates of TargetResponses' standard deviation are provided */
00175         virtual void getUseTargetResponseSd(bool*) = 0;                 /* return byref the value of the use_TargetReponse_sd flag */
00176         virtual void setUseFeatureResponseSd(bool) = 0;              /* 1 if estimates of FeatureResponse standard deviation are provided */
00177         virtual void getUseFeatureResponseSd(bool*) = 0;             /* return byref the value of the use_FeatureResponse_sd flag */
00178         
00179         /* PLIER Parameters {added} */
00180         virtual void setFixPrecomputed(bool) = 0; /* 1 to recompute values as though supplying feature responses*/
00181         virtual void getFixPrecomputed(bool *) = 0; /* return byref precomputed flag */
00182         virtual void setNumericalTolerance(double ) = 0; /*converge to what numerical level*/
00183         virtual void getNumericalTolerance(double *) = 0; /*return byref numerical convergence level*/
00184         virtual void setSafetyZero(double ) = 0; /* ward off log(0) errors when reading in possible zero values*/
00185         virtual void getSafetyZero(double *) =0; /* get the tiny value by ref*/
00186         virtual void setFixFeatureEffect(bool b) = 0; /* Break when limit reached in plierapg::FitAdditiveModel() */
00187         virtual void getFixFeatureEffect(bool* b) = 0; /* Break when limit reached in plierapg::FitAdditiveModel() */
00188 
00189 
00190         
00191 
00192         /* PLIER Inputs (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00193         virtual void setBg(double**) = 0;                       /* currently NULL, intended to allow for provision of background, corresponds to structure of pm */
00194         virtual void getBg(double***) = 0;                      /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_bg" method */
00195 
00196         /* PLIER Inputs/Outputs (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00197         virtual void setTargetResponseSd(double*) = 0;                   /* array of length num_exp for standard deviation of estimated intensities */
00198         virtual void getTargetResponseSd(double**) = 0;                  /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_signal_sd" method */
00199         virtual void setFeatureResponseSd(double*) = 0;               /* array of length num_probe for standard deviation of estimated probe effects */
00200         virtual void getFeatureResponseSd(double**) = 0;              /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_FeatureResponse_sd" method */
00201 
00202         /* PLIER Outputs (RESERVED FOR FUTURE) */
00203         virtual void setResiduals(double**) = 0;                /* Used to return residuals, structure corresponds to pm */
00204         virtual void getResiduals(double***) = 0;               /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_residuals" method */
00205         virtual void setCallPvalue(double*) = 0;               /* array of length num_exp to return detection pvalues */
00206         virtual void getCallPvalue(double**) = 0;              /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_call_pvalue" method */
00207         virtual void setLikelihood(double*) = 0;                /* The likelihood, or some similarly-interpretable quantity */
00208         virtual void getLikelihood(double**) = 0;               /* return byref the pointer that set by using "set_likelihood" method */
00209 
00210         /*
00211          * Set to default PLIER parameters (usable for HG-U133A, for example)
00212          * Input parameters :
00213          *       buffer - [in] Reserved; must be 0
00214          */
00215         virtual void setDefault(void* buffer=0) = 0;
00216 
00217         /*
00218          * Interface to run the PLIER algorithm to obtain outputs
00219          * Input parameter :
00220          *       error_code - [out] Pointer to a long integer which receives
00221          *                    the error code value, set to 0 if no error
00222          */
00223         virtual void run(long* error_code) = 0;
00224 
00225         /*
00226          * Get the plier object implementation name and version number
00227          * Input parameters :
00228          *       plier_impl_name - [out] Pointer to a buffer that receives
00229          *                         a null-terminated string containing the implementation name.
00230          *                         The buffer size should be large enough to contain
00231          *                         MAX_IMPLNAME_LENGTH + 1 characters
00232          *
00233          *       plier_impl_ver  - [out] Pointer to a buffer that receives
00234          *                         a null-terminated string containing the 
00235          *                         The buffer size should be large enough to contain
00236          *                         MAX_IMPLVER_LENGTH + 1 characters
00237          */
00238         virtual void getImplInfo(char* plier_impl_name, char* plier_impl_ver) = 0;
00239 
00240 
00241 private:
00242         int refcnt;  // reference count
00243 };
00244 
00245 /*
00246  * PLIER object creation function
00247  * Input parameters :
00248  *       plier_impl_name - [in] Pointer to a buffer that stores the plier implementation name.
00249  *                         It can be null and then default to PLIER v1 implementation
00250  *                         The buffer size should be at most MAX_IMPLNAME_LENGTH + 1 characters
00251  *
00252  *       plier           - [out] Pointer to a pointer of iaffyplier object to be returned
00253  */
00254 plierdll void createPlierObject(const char* plier_impl_name, iaffyplier** plier);
00255 
00256 /*
00257  * Get the error string
00258  * Input parameters :
00259  *       error_code - [in] Specifies the error code returned in run method
00260  *
00261  *       error      - [out] Pointer to a buffer that receives
00262  *                    a null-terminated string containing the error string.
00263  *                    The buffer size should be large enough to contain
00264  *                    MAX_ERROR_LENGTH + 1 characters
00265  */
00266 plierdll void getPlierError(long error_code, char* error);
